New Records: Zimbabwe defended the lowest total ever against India in a T20I, and the lowest total ever defended against anyone in Harare.
Key Match Events: India collapsed in a hurry, losing four wickets inside five overs
Tendai Chatara bowled a nerveless 20th over, conceding just two runs off four balls and claiming Washington Sundar off the fifth to spark wild scenes in Harare.
Sikandar Raza cleaned up Shubman Gill for 31, the whole of Harare believed.
India needed 16 off the final over with one wicket in hand but still hoped to get through with Washington still around.
Pre-Game Insights: India handed debuts to Abhishek Sharma, Riyan Parag and Dhruv Jurel.
India had no hesitation in bowling first after winning the toss.
Post-Match Reflections: India's post T20 World Cup party hit a snag as Zimbabwe handed them their first defeat in T20Is in 2024.
This is the lowest total ever defended against India in a T20I, and the lowest against anyone in Harare.
This was just Zimbabwe's third win in nine T20Is this year.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The beginning of the take-down: Zimbabwe bowlers found their lengths from the get-go.

Raza opened the bowling with two spinners - Brian Bennett and Wellington Masakadza - and his decision was vindicated immediately; Abhishek top-edged Bennett in the first over to deep backward square leg.
Zimbabwe had the perfect start to their innings when Wessly Madhevere drove Khaleel Ahmed straight down the ground for four.
Others: The Zimbabwe bowlers came out with gusto, picking up wickets at regular intervals to bowl India out for 102 in 19.5 overs.
Raza landed the big blow, beating Gill all ends up with the carrom ball.
Avesh and Washington then eased the nerves briefly with an 18-ball 23-run stand
